paragraph.paragraph:
An Eiffel class item's properties are accessible from the Visual Studio .NET ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfPropertyBrowser.htmproperties window. To view the properties window:
Select an Eiffel class item in your EiffelEnvision ../../../structure/project.xmlProject.
Choose View, Properties menu. The properties window may also been shown for any selected item by pressing the F4 keyboard shortcut or by choosing Properties from a Eiffel class item's context menu.

Excluded From Build
Indicates if the Eiffel class has been excluded from compilation. Note: This property is read-only when the Eiffel class item has not been excluded explicitly, but is excluded because a parent ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/cluster_folders.xmlCluster Folder has been excluded from a ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/explicit_clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folder.

File Name
The name of the file item, the same as in the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog.htmSolution Explorer window. Changing this property will rename the corresponding file item on disk.

Full Path
The full path to the file item on disk.

Missing
This property indicates if the corresponding file on disk exists. If Yes the file cannot be found.

Read Only
Indicates if the corresponding file on disk has the Read-Only attribute set. When set to Yes the file cannot be edited using any editor, in or outside of Visual Studio .NET, adhering to the Read-Only file attribute.
